column1: Facebook Lite was launched in 2015 targeting developing markets and designed to work in areas with slower or limited internet connections. The new rollout will now be available to users in more countries, including the United States, Canada, Australia, United Kingdom, France, Germany, Ireland, and New Zealand. "We've seen that even in some developed markets people can have lower connectivity, so we want to make sure everyone has the option to use this app," the company said.
column2: Johnson Fistel, LLP has launched an investigation into whether the board members of LaSalle Hotel Properties breached their fiduciary duties in connection with the proposed sale of the Company to Blackstone Group LP. Under terms of the deal, Blackstone will pay $33.50 in cash for each LaSale share outstanding. If you are a shareholder of La salle and believe the proposed buyout price is too low or you're interested in learning more about the investigation, please contact
column3: Axios: Drugmakers have hiked list prices on hundreds of drugs at rates that outpace inflation. 39 drugs were hiked more than 100 percent, though most of them aren't commonly used. The largest spike was 1,468 percent for SynerDerm, a skin cream that helps keep a moist wound and skin environment to help with healing. More commonly used medications also saw increases, though not quite as high as some of the rare drugs.
column4: United's treasurer, Gerry Laderman, will take the role of interim CFO. United is the third largest U.S. airline. Levy, a former executive at discount carrier Allegiant Air, joined United in August 2016. The carrier will "immediately" begin a search for a permanent replacement, the airline says. The airline's CEO Oscar Munoz thanked Levy for his service to the carrier.
column5: Website founders Michael Lacey and James Larkin are charged with facilitating prostitution and money laundering. They are already facing state money laundering charges in California. Authorities also have seized Backpage.com and its affiliated websites. The founders are accused of helping customers edit their ads so they would stay within legal limits while still encouraging commercial sex. The site is accused of running ads for sexual services and hiding their revenues.
column6: Etsy reported more than $1 billion in gross merchandising sales (GMS) during its latest quarter. The company posted adjusted earnings per share of 15 cents, ahead of a 9 cent Thomson Reuters consensus estimate. Revenue was $136.3 million, growing 23.6 percent year over year. Active sellers and active buyers percentages also increased by double digits compared to the same period last year.
column7: Comerica Incorporated will release first quarter 2018 financial results on Tuesday, . That morning, Comerica will host a conference call to review the results. The live audio webcast, earnings release and earnings presentation will be available on the Investor Relations Presentations and Events page on A replay (accessible for one year) of the call is expected to be available one hour after the live webcast.
column8: The Board of Directors of Waddell & Reed Financial, Inc. approved a quarterly dividend on its Class A common stock of $0.25 per share. The dividend is payable on to stockholders of record as of . The company will announce first quarter 2018 earnings before trading begins on the New York Stock Exchange, Tuesday, May1, 2018, followed by a conference call at 10:00 a.m. Eastern.
column9: Gross domestic product is now estimated to grow an annual 6.5 percent in 2017/18, slower than a provisional 7.1 percent growth in 2016/17. Most private economists have pared the growth forecast to 6.2 percent for this fiscal year, citing the teething troubles faced by the roll out of a goods and services tax (GST) Sectors such as manufacturing and hotels were badly hit by the new tax.
column10: Dunkin' Donuts will offer a slightly smaller menu starting on Monday, aiming for speedier, more accurate service. The scaled-back menus will appear in New England and upstate New York this week, and roll out to the rest of the nation before the end of March. The company tried out the simplified menu in several markets starting in early 2017, and by the autumn expanded the test to almost 1,000 locations.
column11: President Donald Trump has questioned the legality of special counsel Robert Mueller's probe. Trump suggested the probe was prompted by classified information leaked by former FBI director James Comey. Trump has reportedly considered firing special counsel Mueller at least twice last year, and has repeatedly slammed the Russia probe as a "witch hunt" But as of late the president seemed to back off his attacks on Mueller and Deputy Attorney General Rod Rosenstein, who oversees the Russia investigation.
column12: Magellan Midstream Partners, L.P. plans to announce financial results for first quarter 2018 before the market opens on May 3. Management will discuss first-quarter earnings, outlook for the remainder of 2018 and the status of significant expansion projects during a conference call with analysts at 1:30 p.m. Eastern the same day. To join the conference call, dial (877) 260-1479 and provide code 9386289. Investors also may listen to the call via
column13: Monster Beverage Corp. (MNST) reported first-quarter profit of $216.1 million. Earnings, adjusted for non-recurring costs, came to 39 cents per share. The energy drink maker posted revenue of $850.9 million in the period. Monster Beverage shares hit $53.08, a climb of 9.5 percent in the last 12 months.
column14: Boston Private Financial Holdings, Inc. will report fourth quarter and full year 2017 financial results after market close on Wednesday, . Management will hold a conference call at 8 a.m. Eastern Time on Thursday, to discuss the financial results, business highlights and outlook. The call will be simultaneously webcast and may be accessed on
column15: The Labor Department said Friday that openings fell 2.8 percent to 6.05 million, down from 6.23 million in January. Layoffs dropped a steep 7.7 percent, to 1.65 million. There are now just 1.08 unemployed people, on average, for every available job. When the Great Recession ended, there were 6.7 people out of work for every opening.
column16: The 9th Circuit Court of Appeals upheld a lower court's decision to dismiss the case. The case was brought by a group of citizens who say they were misled by the White House. The judge ruled that the case should be dismissed because it violated the Constitution's guarantee of free speech. The decision was made on the basis of a complaint filed by a man who says he was misled by White House officials about the matter.
column17: Shares of the company rose 2.5 percent at $102.50 in premarket trading on Monday. Sales rose 3 percent in its personal care segment, which includes brands such as Huggies and Pull-Ups, and 9 percent in the consumer tissue segment which includes Kleenex and Scott. Results in the latest quarter included $577 million in restructuring charges, the company said.
column18: Commerce Secretary Wilbur Ross said the tariffs announced Thursday reflect a lack of progress with Mexico and Canada over NAFTA negotiations. Ross also downplayed the impact of the tariffs on prices and the U.S. economy. The tariffs of 25 percent on steel imports and 10 percent on aluminum imports will take effect at midnight Thursday. The Trump administration announced it will put tariffs on steel and aluminum imports from Canada, Mexico and the European Union.
column19: Apple releases iOS 11.2.6 to fix a text message bug. The bug crashed iMessage, WhatsApp, Gmail and Facebook Messenger when received. You can update your iPhone by visiting Settings > General > Software update. It's a relatively small update considering that the larger, more feature-packed iOS11.3 is in test phase and on its way soon. It also affected Apple's Mac operating system.
column20: Billionaire Carl Icahn said he has a large position in Rubbermaid parent Newell Brands. Icahn joins other activist investors including Starboard Value and Martin Franklin in their bid to reform the company. Newell produces a variety of consumer and commercial goods from power tools to child car seats. The industrial conglomerate operates under many brands including Sharpie, Paper Mate, Mr. Coffee and Coleman.
column21: The yield on the 10-year Treasury Bond is mostly flat and holding at the 2.70 percent level. Amazon, Berkshire Hathaway, and J.P. Morgan Chase are teaming up to create a landmark new non-profit health care company. A major Chinese solar manufacturer is announcing plans to get around the tariff by opening a plant in the U.S. The Case-Shiller home price index and consumer confidence report are released today.
column22: U.S. President Donald Trump spoke with senior Saudi and Emirati leaders on Tuesday. They discussed ways to counter Iran's "destabilizing activities," the White House said. The two princes are planning to meet with Trump in March and April, a senior official said. Washington hopes to set up a summit of the six-member Gulf Cooperation Council later this year, the official added.
column23: Visa CEO Alfred Kelly, Jr. said growth in both cross-border and payments volume helped drive the better-than-expected results. The company said both metrics grew 11 percent year over year. Visa shares have gained 5 percent so far this year, outperforming the Dow Jones industrial average which has fallen 3 percent in the same period. In February, Visa said it plans to acquire longtime partner Fraedom as the company seeks to expand its footprint in the digital payment industry.
column24: The deal is subject to NFL approval and is expected to close in July. Tepper, who runs Appaloosa Management, would have to sell his stake in the Pittsburgh Steelers. "I am thrilled to have been selected to be the next owner of the Carolina Panthers," Tepper says. The deal has been reported to be worth a league-record $2.2 billion, according to reports.
column25: The president's remarks come as the government scrambles to pass a bill that would extend government funding beyond the end of Thursday. Last February, the president made waves at the breakfast by taking jabs at Arnold Schwarzenegger, who hosted a new version of Trump's former NBC reality series "Celebrity Apprentice" The president is slated to deliver a speech to the National Prayer Breakfast at 8 am ET.
column26: Ford is expanding a safety recall for its Ford Transit vans. The recall now includes nearly 100,000 of the cargo vans, which are often used to transport up to 15 people at a time. Potentially affected vehicles are equipped with a trailer-tow module, which is vulnerable to seeping water that can corrode the module's wiring. Ford said it is aware of two fires related to the issue but no accidents or injuries.
column27: The U.S. is set to become one of the world's largest electric vehicle producers. The U.K. is expected to become a major player in the global electric vehicle market. The European Union is also set to expand its electric vehicle network. The E.U. is also expected to increase the number of electric vehicles on the road in the next few years. The world's electric vehicles are expected to grow at a faster rate than any other country.
column28: Sears said it was notified of the incident in mid-March and the incident led to unauthorized access to the credit card information of under 100,000 of its customers. The incident happened on or after Sept. 26, 2017 last year and was found and resolved on Oct. 12, the company said.Personal details related to passport, government identification, security and SkyMiles information were not impacted, Delta said.
column29: German authorities foil a knife attack on Berlin's half-marathon. Four men were reportedly detained by police ahead of a planned attack. According to German media, the main suspect knew Anis Amri, the Tunisian attacker who drove a truck into a Christmas market in Berlin two years ago. The paper reported that the suspect had prepared extra-sharpened knives to use in the attack.
column30: Melissa Gustafson is promoted to vice president, Strategic Initiatives and Program Management, Sales & Products. She will direct the development and execution of all cross-divisional initiatives involving Sales & products. Gustafon brings more than 18 years of project management experience to this role. Erie Insurance Group is the 10th largest homeowners insurer and 11th largest automobile insurer in the United States.
column31: President Donald Trump calls for new border wall and immigration legislation. He says moving to the "nuclear option" in the Senate is only way to muscle such a measure through. But that would require changing Senate rules, something for which Senate Majority Leader Mitch McConnell has shown no enthusiasm. Trump also tweeted that the U.S. must build a border wall, but argued that "Democrats want No Borders, hence drugs and crime!"
column32: The Los Angeles-based real estate investment trust said it had funds from operations of $115.1 million in the first quarter. Funds from operations is a closely watched measure in the REIT industry. The company's shares have fallen 44 percent since the beginning of the year. The stock has decreased 52 percent in the last 12 months. The provider of asset management services to NorthStar Realty Finance Corp., based in Los Angeles, posted revenue of $666.7 million.
column33: The dividends for the Preferred Stock Series A, C, E, F, G, I and K are payable on to stockholders of record at the close of business on . Morgan Stanley is a leading global financial services firm providing investment banking, securities, wealth management and investment management services. For more information about Morgan Stanley, please visit
column34: The provider of Medicaid-related services posted revenue of $4.95 billion in the period. For the year, the company reported a loss of $512 million, or $9.07 per share. Molina expects full-year earnings in the range of $3.23-3.73 per share, with revenue expected to be $18.8 billion. In the final minutes of trading on Monday, shares hit $78.42, an increase of 31 percent.
column35: Hudson's Bay says it has identified the issue and taken steps to contain it. Customers will not be liable for fraudulent charges that may result from the issue, the company says. The affected stores are Saks Fifth Avenue, Saks OFF 5TH and Lord & Taylor. The company is "coordinating with law enforcement and the payment card companies," it adds. The issue has not affected the company's e-commerce platforms.
column36: China to step up quarantine checks on imports of apples and logs from the United States. Shipments found carrying disease or rot could be returned or destroyed, customs agency says. U.S. President Donald Trump has threatened to impose tariffs on up to $150 billion in Chinese goods. Fruits were among 128 goods that China slapped with more expensive import tariffs early last month in retaliation for U.s. levies on Chinese steel and aluminum.
column37: SVB Financial Group (SIVB) on Thursday reported fourth-quarter profit of $117.2 million. The bank, based in Santa Clara, California, said it had earnings of $2.19 per share. The results exceeded Wall Street expectations. For the year, the company reported profit of $490.5 million, or $9.20 per share; revenue was reported as $1.98 billion.
column38: The Puerto Rico Electric Power Authority has yet to recover fully from the devastation wrought by Hurricane Maria. The process to unload the indebted company could take roughly 18 months to complete. All 3.4 million residents of the U.S. territory are still in the dark after Hurricane Maria knocked out power to the entire island and left all of them without power. The Puerto Rican government said on Monday it would sell off its troubled power utility to the private sector.
column39: The Western Union Company (NYSE: WU) is a global leader in cross-border, cross-currency money movement. As of , our network included over 550,000 retail agent locations offering Western Union, Vigo or Orlandi Valuta branded services. In 2017, we moved over $300 billion in principal in nearly 130 currencies and processed 32 transactions every second across all our services.
column40: The Board of Directors of Pure Multi-Family REIT (GP) Inc. has approved a cash distribution of US$0.03125 per unit for the month of February 2018. The distribution will be paid on to unitholders of record at the close of business on .Pure Multi- family is a Canadian based, publically traded vehicle which offers investors exclusive exposure to U.S. multi-family real estate assets.
column41: ViaSat Inc. (VSAT) reported a fiscal third-quarter loss of $24.6 million. On a per-share basis, the Carlsbad, California-based company said it had a loss of 42 cents. The provider of satellite and wireless networking technology posted revenue of $381.8 million. ViaSat shares have decreased slightly more than 5 percent since the beginning of the year.
column42: Airlines are waiving change fees for passengers booked to fly Thursday or Friday. A record-setting blast of cold is expected to follow the system. Southwest Airlines warned that flights to and from 19 East Coast airports may be canceled, delayed or diverted. American Airlines issued a similar waiver for more than a dozen airports in the Northeast. The largest U.S. airline is also waiving fees for travel from 14 airports in South, including Savannah.
column43: Titan International, Inc. will release its fourth quarter 2017 financial results on Friday, February 23, to be followed by a teleconference and webcast at 9:00 a.m. Eastern Time. The real-time, listen-only webcast can be accessed on our website at within the "Investor Relations" page under the "News & Events" menu. Listeners should access the website at least 15 minutes prior to the
column44: Rowley Law PLLC is investigating potential claims against MuleSoft, Inc. and its board of directors for breach of fiduciary duty. The proposed acquisition of the company by Salesforce is valued at approximately $6.5 billion. Stockholders will receive $36.00 and 0.0711 shares of Salesforce common stock for each share of Mule soft stock they hold. The transaction is expected to close by .
column45: Terreno Realty Corp. (TRNO) says it had funds from operations of $15.6 million in the fourth quarter. The results met Wall Street expectations. The industrial real estate company posted revenue of $34.6million in the period. For the year, the company reported funds from Operations of $56.1 million, or $1.09 per share. The company's shares have dropped 5 percent since the beginning of the year.
column46: Trimble Navigation Ltd. (TRMB) on Monday reported first-quarter profit of $58.5 million. The results surpassed Wall Street expectations. The GPS manufacturer posted revenue of $742.2 million in the period. For the current quarter ending in July, Trimble expects its per-share earnings to range from 42 cents to 46 cents. The company expects revenue in the range of $755 million to $785 million for the fiscal second quarter.
column47: The audio technology company posted revenue of $79.7 million in the period. For the year, the company reported that its loss narrowed to $3.2 million. Parametric Sound said it expects revenue in the range of $29 million for the current quarter. The company expects a full-year loss of 3 cents per share, with revenue expected to be $157 million. The shares hit 56 cents in the final minutes of trading on Tuesday.
column48: Security software company Symantec says its board is investigating concerns raised by an ex-employee. The matter has been relayed to the SEC, the company says. The stock dropped $5.80 to $23.38 after the announcement. Rosen Law Firm, a firm that represents investors, says it's investigating whether the company "may have issued materially misleading business information to the investing public"
column49: WikiLeaks says it has been banned from using cryptocurrency firm's payments service. WikiLeaks sells items such as T-shirts and posters, allowing people to pay in bitcoin. The group has had a rocky history with payment processors such as Mastercard and Visa. WikiLeaks tweeted that it would "call for a global blockade of Coinbase" because it is "an unfit member of the crypto community" The firm was not immediately available for comment when contacted by CNBC.
column50: Spotify is pursuing an unusual direct listing to reach the public markets in place of an initial public offering. The reference price is not an offering price for the shares, nor is it the opening public price for shares of the Swedish technology company. Spotify has hired Citadel Securities as a market maker to set the opening price on the NYSE. Early on Tuesday, Citadel and Morgan Stanley will analyze investors' buy and sell orders and then set an opening price.
column51: Amgen Inc. (AMGN) on Tuesday reported first-quarter net income of $2.31 billion. The results exceeded Wall Street expectations. The world's largest biotech drugmaker posted revenue of $5.55 billion in the period. Amgen expects full-year earnings in the range of $12.80 to $13.70 per share. the Standard & Poor's 500 index has declined 1.5 percent.
column52: Roku Inc. will release first quarter 2018 results after the stock market close on Wednesday, . The company will host a live webcast of its conference call to discuss the results at 2 p.m. Pacific Time. Participants may access the live webcasts in listen-only mode on the Roku investor relations website at . An archived webcasts of the conference call will also be available at
column53: array BioPharma Inc. will report financial results for the third quarter of fiscal 2018 and hold a conference call to discuss those results on Wednesday, . Ron Squarer, Chief Executive Officer, will lead the call. Ten registration studies are currently advancing related to eight Array-owned or partnered drugs: encorafenib (LGX818), binimetinib (MEK162), ARRY-797 and selumetinib.
column54: Bellicum is a leader in developing novel, controllable cellular immunotherapies for cancers and orphan inherited blood disorders. The Company will host a conference call and live webcast on Tuesday, at 5:00 p.m. Eastern to report its fourth quarter and full year 2017 financial results and provide a corporate update. To access the call, participants should dial 877-407-3103 (U.S. domestic) and 201-493-67
column55: The dividend is payable on , to shareholders of record as of . This represents an increase of 11.1% from the prior quarterly cash dividend of $0.18 per common share. Umpqua Bank has locations across Oregon, Washington, California, Idaho and Nevada. The bank is recognized for its entrepreneurial approach, innovative customer experience, and distinctive banking solutions.
column56: Varian will report results for the second quarter of fiscal year 2018 after market close on Wednesday, . The news release will be followed by a teleconference available to all interested at 2:00 p.m. Pacific Time. To access the teleconference call and replay: Access from within the U.S. by dialing 1-877-869-3847.
column57: The move ends months of limbo for Amazon's entertainment division. Amazon Studios has been working to shake up its programming lineup. Salke will be in charge of Amazon's blockbuster bet on a television prequel to "The Lord of the Rings" People familiar with the matter say the studio offered $250 million for the fantasy series' rights alone. The bill will climb as Amazon invests in production and marketing for multiple seasons.
column58: Valmont Industries, Inc. will hold its Fourth Quarter 2017 Earnings Conference Call on Thursday, beginning at 8:00 a.m. CST. An audio discussion of Valmont's fourth quarter 2017 results will be available live by telephone by dialing 1-877-493-2981 and entering Conference ID#: 2874769. The Company's slide presentation for the call will be simultaneously available on the Investors page at
column59: South Africa's MTN aims to list its Nigerian unit in an initial public offering this year. Group chief executive Rob Shuter said plans were well advanced. Shuter was speaking in Lagos after MTN signed an agreement with Ecobank to form a partnership on mobile banking across Africa. He added the South African telecoms group was targeting 60 million customers via mobile services over the next three years.
column60: Chevron Corp. (CVX) on Friday reported first-quarter earnings of $3.64 billion. On a per-share basis, the San Ramon, California-based company said it had net income of $1.90. The results surpassed Wall Street expectations, but Chevron does not adjust its reported results based on one-time events such as asset sales. The oil company posted revenue of $37.76 billion in the period.
column61: U.S. raises tariffs on steel from Vietnam that Washington says originated in China. The announcement follows this week's truce in a broader trade dispute between Beijing and Washington. Imports of cold-rolled steel from Vietnamese rose from $9 million to $215 million, the Commerce Department said. It said imports of corrosion-resistant steel from. Vietnam rose from Â£2 million to Â£80 million.
column62: Ballard Power Systems will hold a conference call on Wednesday, at 8:00 a.m. Pacific Time. The live call can be accessed by dialing +1-604-638-5340. The webcast will be archived in the 'Investor Presentations & Events' area of Ballard's website ( ).
column63: Adidas had opposed Belgian company Shoe Branding Europe's application for two EU trademarks for two parallel stripes on shoes as it was too similar to its own iconic three-stripe design. The European Union Intellectual Property Office refused registration in separate decisions in 2015 and 2016. The Luxembourg-based General Court on Thursday affirmed the EUIPO's decisions, saying that the design would take unfair advantage of Adidas reputation.
column64: The U.S. Department of Agriculture is looking to find ways to shield farmers from the growing trade conflict between the United States and China. "There's a lot of different options out there" to protect farmers, said USDA Farm Production And Conservation Under Secretary Bill Northey. Northey was speaking after President Donald Trump ordered officials to come up with an additional round of tariffs directed at China.
column65: Jacob Zuma is to face corruption charges for a 30 billion rand ($2.5 billion) arms deal dating back to the late 1990s. The announcement was made Friday afternoon by Shaun Abrahams, national director of public prosecutions at the National Prosecuting Authority. Zuma was at the center of a political firestorm earlier this year, forced to resign as president by his ruling African National Congress party.
column66: Xiaopeng is one of several Chinese start-ups looking to speed up development of battery-powered technology and compete with global leaders including Tesla. The latest injection brings the startup company's total funding to 5 billion yuan, it It follows an earlier round in December in which Alibaba also participated. China's new energy vehicle sales are expected to grow by 40 percent in 2018, according to an industry body.
column67: Lincoln Electric is the world leader in the design, development and manufacture of arc welding products, robotic arc welding systems and plasma and oxyfuel cutting equipment. Headquartered in Cleveland, Ohio, Lincoln has 63 manufacturing locations, including operations and joint ventures in 23 countries and a worldwide network of distributors and sales offices. For more information about Lincoln Electric and its products and services, visit the Company's website at
column68: Dan Loeb 's Third Point hedge fund took a 2 million share stake in Netflix in the fourth quarter of last year. Loeb's fund returned 18.1 percent last year, according to a letter obtained by CNBC. The streaming stock becomes the ninth-largest equity long holding in the fund.Shares of Netflix rose mildly in after-hours trading, after climbing 2.99 percent during Wednesday's session.
column69: eGlobalTech, an award-winning IT solutions, cyber security, and management consulting firm based in Arlington, VA, has appointed new leadership. The CEO position will be assumed by Sanjiv Jain, who has been serving as the firm's Chief Administrative Officer (CAO) Branko Primetica has been appointed President and Chief Strategy Officer (CSO) Joseph Zimmerman has been named Chief Operating Officer (COO) Each of these individuals has been with the firm for
column70: Debra Perelman replaces Fabian Garcia, who stepped down in January after two years. She has 20 years at Revlon and was most recently chief operating officer at the company. Her billionaire father is also chairman of Revlon, which is controlled by MacAndrews & Forbes. Paul Meister, who was overseeing day-to-day operations on an interim basis, will keep his position as the vice chairman.
column71: Shares of the company, which makes Norton Antivirus, fell 13.3 percent to $25.30 in extended trading. An audit committee of Symantec's board has retained independent counsel and other advisers to assist in the investigation. The investigation is in its early stages and unlikely to be completed to file the annual report in time, the company said. The company has contacted the Securities and Exchange Commission and plans to provide additional information to the SEC as the investigation proceeds.
column72: The last shipments of romaine lettuce from Yuma, Arizona were harvested on April 16, the FDA says. The reported strain of E. coli can cause severe abdominal cramps, bloody diarrhea and vomiting. The Centers for Disease Control and Prevention said on May 2 one person from California had died related to the outbreak.Twenty-three more people fell ill since the last update on May 9, bringing the total to 172 people.
column73: Capital Power Corporation (TSX:CPX) will release its first quarter 2018 results before the markets open on . Management will host a conference call with analysts on the same day at 9:00 a.m. MDT. The Company will also be hosting its annual meeting of shareholders at 1:00 pm (MDT) on at the EPCOR Tower.
column74: Sears Holdings said Thursday it will be shuttering 72 more stores in 2018. This is in addition to the 64 Kmart stores and 39 Sears stores that have already shut down this year. The company will end 2018 with fewer than 1,000 locations spread across the U.S. altogether. The department store chain made the store closure announcement Thursday in tandem with reporting its first-quarter earnings.
column75: U.S. defense contractor took a $1.9 billion charge in the fourth quarter ended Dec. 31. Lockheed Martin is expected to gain from an increase in defense spending under President Donald Trump 's administration. The company expects 2018 net sales in the range of $50.00 billion-$51.50 billion and earnings per share of $15.20-$15.50, according to a report.
column76: Hoegh LNG Partners LP's first quarter 2018 results will be released on Thursday, , before the market opens. In connection with this, a presentation will be held at 8:30 A.M. (EST) on May 31. The results and presentation material will be available for download at . There will be a Q&A session after the presentation.
column77: NXRT's board of directors has declared a quarterly dividend of $0.25 per share of NXRT common stock. The dividend is payable on to stockholders of record on . NXRT is externally advised by NexPoint Real Estate Advisors, L.P., an affiliate of Highland Capital Management, Inc., a leading global alternative asset manager and an SEC-registered investment adviser.
column78: Apple has said it plans to make $38 billion in tax payments to reflect new tax rules passed last year. Wall Street has speculated that the lower tax rates may open the door for Apple to bring back cash from overseas. The iPhone maker says it will contribute $350 billion to the U.S. economy over the next five years, in the form of payments to suppliers, capital expenditures, advanced manufacturing investments and jobs.
column79: Brazil's patent office has concluded that Monsanto Co's Intacta RR2 Pro patent should be declared void. Aprosoja's Mato Grosso branch in November asked a Brazil federal court to cancel Monsanto's patent. The grain growers association said the patent did not bring real technological innovation. Monsanto said in a statement on Monday that it was informed of INPI's opinion and said it will challenge the allegations in due course.
column80: Japanese Prime Minister Shinzo Abe wants to meet with South Korean President Moon Jae-in to convey Japan's stance on the 2015 agreement on "comfort women" "I also want to drive home the need for strong collaboration between Japan, South Korea and the United States to counter the North Korean threat, and to maintain the maximum level of pressure (against Pyongyang)," he said. Abe confirmed his plans to attend the Pyeongchang Olympics next month.
column81: HPE also forecast an adjusted profit of 29 cents to 33 cents per share for the second quarter. The Palo Alto, California-based company's Hybrid IT division, largely made up of its storage products, rose 10 percent to $6.33 billion in the first quarter. Total revenue rose 11 per cent to $7.67 billion, according to Thomson Reuters I/B/E/S.
column82: Maine Media Collective has hired Scott Wentzell as its Marketing Director. He brings almost 30 years of marketing and brand-development experience to the organization. Maine Media Collective publishes Maine, Maine Home+Design, Ageless Maine and Old Port magazines. It produces Love Maine Radio, the Kennebunkport Festival and the Boothbay Harbor Food and Wine Festival. It is home to Art Collector Maine and the Brand Company.
column83: President Donald Trump called media mega-celebrity Oprah Winfrey "insecure" after watching the television icon's "60 Minutes" show. Trump claimed that Winfrey posed "biased and slanted" questions to a panel on the CBS news program. He also added that he hoped she would run for office so "she can be exposed and defeated just like all of the others" Winfrey, a talk show host, actress and philanthropist, made her debut on '60 Minutes
column84: Nektar Therapeutics will announce its financial results for the first quarter on Thursday, , after the close of U.S.-based financial markets. Howard Robin, president and chief executive officer, will host a conference call to review the results. The press release and a live audio-only Webcast of the conference call can be accessed through a link that is posted on the home page and Investors section of the Nektar website:
column85: The new 777X aircraft will sport an extended wingspan of 235 feet. The folding wing will allow pilots to reduce the plane's wingspan down to 212 feet. It will only work when the plane is on the ground and the FAA developed a Special Conditions document to ensure that the technology meets safety standards. Boeing is scheduled to bring the new 777Z series to market in 2020. The new design will bring more flight efficiency but might not fit into how airports are built.
column86: Shares of Red Hat surged nearly 5 percent after hours after the open-source software company reported its fourth-quarter earnings. SM Energy stock gained over 2 percent in extended trading. The natural gas exploration company announced that it completed a previously announced sale of the majority of its assets in the Powder River Basin for $500 million. The company plans to use the proceeds for general corporate purposes, including debt reduction.
column87: James Pitaro has led Disney's consumer products and interactive media division since 2016. He succeeds John Skipper, who resigned in December to deal with substance abuse issues. He takes the helm as Disney readies its direct-to-consumer streaming service. The company's forthcoming streaming service could pose a challenge to incumbents in the space like Netflix , bolstered by ESPN's live sports offerings.
column88: Rowley Law PLLC is investigating potential claims against Callidus Software Inc. and its board of directors. The proposed acquisition of the company by SAP SE is valued at approximately $2.4 billion. Stockholders will receive $36.00 for each share they hold. The transaction is expected to close in the second quarter of 2018. If you are a stockholder and are interested in obtaining additional information regarding this investigation, please visit us at:
column89: Cedar Realty Trust, Inc. will release financial results for the three-month period ended after the market closes on . The Company will host a conference call that same day at 5:00 PM (ET) to discuss the financial results. A live webcast will be available online on the Company's website at
column90: Macerich declares quarterly cash dividend of $.74 per share of common stock. The dividend is payable on to stockholders of record at the close of business on . Macerich currently owns 53 million square feet of real estate consisting primarily of interests in 48 regional shopping centers. The company has earned NAREIT's prestigious "Leader in the Light" award every year from 2014-2017.
column91: A new blockchain exchange-traded fund launched Wednesday on the New York Stock Exchange. The REX BKCM ETF (BKC) holds shares of 32 companies working in cryptocurrencies or their underlying blockchain technology. BKC traded little changed Wednesday morning near $25.14 a share. The Securities and Exchange Commission has not yet allowed a bitcoin ETF to list due to issues such as liquidity and extreme price volatility.
column92: Motorcar Parts of America Inc. (MPAA) reported a fiscal third-quarter loss of $6.8 million. On a per-share basis, the Torrance, California-based company said it had a loss of 36 cents. The maker of remanufactured vehicle alternators and starters posted revenue of $100.1 million. Motorcar Parts expects full-year revenue in the range of $434 million to $440 million.
column93: Dannon accused Federico Muyshondt of stealing confidential business strategies and employee salary data. Dannon and Chobani, known for its Greek yogurt, are major brands in the roughly $8.8 billion U.S. yogurt market. The confidential settlement between Dannon, a unit of France's Danone, was disclosed in filings on Wednesday. MuysHondt represented that he has not used or shared Dannon's trade secrets.
column94: The Board of Directors of Pure Multi-Family REIT (GP) Inc. has approved a cash distribution of US$0.03125 per unit for the month of March 2018. The distribution will be paid on to unitholders of record at the close of business on .Pure Multi- family is a Canadian based, publically traded vehicle which offers investors exclusive exposure to attractive U.S. multi-family real estate assets.
column95: Amazon Web Services is now the fifth-largest software company in the world. The only companies ahead of it are Microsoft, Oracle and SAP. Analysts are projecting 38 percent growth at AWS this year. The company could pass SAP in size before the end of 2019, according to FactSet. It generated $17.5 billion in revenue in 2017, up from $9.9 billion in 2012.
column96: Some government agencies will run out of money at the end of Friday if lawmakers cannot pass a spending bill. House Republicans are pushing for a stopgap bill to fund the government through mid-February. However, Democrats who seek protections for hundreds of thousands of young undocumented immigrants could oppose the spending plan. Some Republicans may threaten to oppose another temporary measure. The Senate is expected to vote on a bill later this week.
column97: The dividend is payable on to common stockholders of record as of , with an ex-dividend date of . AGNC's tangible net book value per common share will be announced concurrently with the Company's fourth quarter earnings release. For further information, please refer to or call (301) 968-9300.
column98: China Pharma Holdings, Inc. plans to hold its fiscal year 2017 earnings conference call on Tuesday, at 8:30 a.m. ET. Listeners may access the call by dialing 1-866-519-4004 or 65-671-350-90 for international callers, Conference ID # 1264719. A replay of the call will be accessible through .
column99: Natera Inc. (NTRA) reported a loss of $32.9 million in its first quarter. The results did not meet Wall Street expectations. The genetic testing company posted revenue of $62.3 million in the period. Natera expects full-year revenue in the range of $250 million to $275 million. The company's shares have increased 30 percent since the beginning of the year.
column100: The board of directors of Lennox International Inc. voted to increase the quarterly cash dividend 25 percent to $0.64 per share of common stock. The dividend is payable on , to stockholders of record as of . LII stock is listed on the New York Stock Exchange and traded under the symbol "LII"."Safe Harbor" Statement under the Private Securities Litigation Reform Act of 1995: Statements in this press release which are not historical
